sen.j: 小出 英貞（こいで ふささだ、天和 (日本)4年2月16日 (旧暦)（1684年3月31日）- 延享元年11月15日 (旧暦)（1744年12月18日））は、丹波国園部藩の第4代藩主。
sen.e: Fusasada KOIDE (March 31, 1684 - December 18, 1744) was the fourth feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
Fusasada KOIDE (March 31, 1684 - December 18, 1744) was the fourth feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
Fusasada KOIDE (March 31, 1684 - December 18, 1744) was the fourth feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
He was the fourth of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the fourth head of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the fourth head of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.

sen.j: 第3代藩主・小出英利の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of the third feudal lord, Fusatoshi KOIDE.
He was the first son of the third feudal lord, Fusatoshi KOIDE.
He was the first son of the third feudal lord, Fusatoshi KOIDE.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Yorizumi MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Yorizumi MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Yorizumi MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 子に小出英持（長男）、娘（堀直為正室）、娘（稲垣昭賢正室）。
sen.e: He had three children, Fusayoshi KOIDE (the first son) and two daughters (lawful wife of Naoyuki HORI, lawful wife of Terukata INAGAKI).
He had three children, Fusayoshi KOIDE (the first son) and two daughters (lawful wife of Naoyuki HORI, lawful wife of Terukata INAGAKI).
He had three children, Fusayoshi KOIDE (the first son) and two daughters (lawful wife of Naoyuki HORI, lawful wife of Terukata INAGAKI).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、信濃国守。
sen.e: He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province).
He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province).
He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province).

sen.j: 宝永2年（1705年）4月22日、父の隠居により家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: On May 14, 1705, he succeeded to the family property due to his father's retirement.
On May 14, 1705, he succeeded to the family property due to his father's retirement.
On May 14, 1705, he succeeded to the family property due to his father's retirement.

sen.j: このとき、弟の小出英治に1000石を分与した。
sen.e: On this occasion, he distributed 1,000 koku to his younger brother Fusaharu KOIDE.
On this occasion, he distributed 1,000 koku crop yields to his younger brother Fusaharu KOIDE.
On this occasion, he distributed 1,000 koku (crop yields) to his younger brother Fusaharu KOIDE.

sen.j: 享保10年（1725年）5月に奏者番、6月には寺社奉行を兼任する。
sen.e: In June, 1725, he was appointed as sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), and in July, 1725, he was also appointed as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) and held two posts, sojaban and jisha-bugyo.

In June, 1725, he was appointed as sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), and in July, 1725, he was also appointed as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) and held two posts, sojaban and jisha-bugyo.

In June, 1725, he was appointed as sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies), and in July, 1725, he was also appointed as jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) and held two posts, sojaban and jisha-bugyo.

sen.j: 寛保2年（1742年）には西の丸若年寄となる。
sen.e: In 1742, he became nishinomaru wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu).
In 1742, he became nishinomaru wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu).
In 1742, he became nishinomaru wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu).

sen.j: 藩政においても江戸藩邸に藩校を創設している。
sen.e: In domain duties, he established hanko (a domain school) in edohantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).
In domain duties, he established hanko (a domain school) in Edo hantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).
In domain duties, he established hanko (a domain school) in Edo hantei (residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).

sen.j: 延享元年（1744年）、病気を理由に全ての職を辞そうとしたが、許されないまま11月15日に61歳で死去した。
sen.e: In 1744, although he decided to resign all his posts because of illness, his offer remained unaccepted and died on November 15, at the age of 61.
In 1744, although he decided to resign all his posts because of illness, his offer remained unaccepted and died on December 18, at the age of 61.
sen.cmt: 冒頭に合わせグレゴリオ暦に変更
sen.e: In 1744, although he decided to resign all his posts because of illness, his offer remained unaccepted and died on December 18, at the age of 61.

sen.j: 後を長男・英持が継いだ。
sen.e: After that, his first son, Fusayoshi succeeded him.
His first son, Fusayoshi succeeded him.
His first son, Fusayoshi succeeded him.
